author: andschwa
body:
Resolves #570.

PowerShell cmdlets now accept both '/' and '\' as directory separators on Linux.

This is _work in progress_ as now I need to get escaping of backslashes to work correctly.

comments.author: vors
comments.body: Does this change include escaping to allow use "foo\bar" as a file-name on Linux as `foo`\bar` ?

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
@vors

> This is work in progress as now I need to get escaping of backslashes to work correctly.

comments.author: vors
comments.body: LGTM, @lzybkr can you take a look?

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: [This branch](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/tree/andschwa/path-normalization) has more WIP, stripping out normalization and handling it explicitly for escaped backslashes. Major WIP but any pointers would welcome, it's gonna be tricky.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @JamesWTruher I think we need to sit-down and design how we're going to handle the escaping. There are a few options.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @vors I added the known issue for the current behavior. Do you sign-off?

title: Make PowerShell slash-agnostic on Linux
